Article.description: The Article model represents a blog post authored by a User, which can have comments and favorites, features certain field validations, generates a unique slug, and supports tagging and user-specific queries.

scopes.authored_by: Returns all articles authored by a particular user
scopes.favorited_by: Returns all articles favorited by a particular user

Comment.description: The Comment model represents a comment made by a User on an Article. It belongs to a User and an Article, and validates the presence of the body attribute.

Favorite.description: The Favorite model represents a user's favorite article. It belongs to a user and an article, and supports a counter cache for the article association.

Follow.description: The Follow model represents a record of a user following another user or entity. It utilizes the 'acts_as_follower' gem to provide follower functionality.

User.description: The User model represents a registered user in the application. It includes authentication functionality provided by the Devise gem. Users can create articles, favorite articles, and leave comments. The model also includes methods for generating JSON Web Tokens (JWT) and checking if a user has favorited a specific article.
